0.72.text: I once had a holiday in a Frenchman's garage.

7.20.text: Can I check if this is a euphemism?

11.84.text: But seriously, how old were you, roughly? I don't mean go,

19.04.text: You're 38, right, you're in France. Where was the garage?

22.08.text:
- France!
- Whereabouts in France? 
- Northern France.

27.00.text: In Brittany. So you ended up in Brittany?

28.80.text:
- Southern Brittany. 
- Southern Brittany and you...

31.08.text: The northern end of southern Brittany.

34.28.text: Oh, that's just south of mid Brittany, isn't it?

37.40.text:
- I know it well.
- Mid Brittany.

40.16.text:
- HAL:
- What was the name of the town that you were in?

42.28.text: The town where I stayed in the Frenchman's garage...

47.04.text:
- Vannes.
- You were in the van in the garage, right.

52.44.text: Is this how this mix-up happened? "I want a holiday in a van."

57.36.text: Rhod, Rhod. Let me speak to you as another Welshman.

63.36.text: Ask me a nice specific question.

65.80.text: Did you book a holiday in a Frenchman's garage?

70.16.text: No. I once HAD a holiday in a Frenchman's garage.

74.52.text: When you arrived in the village or town called Vannes...

78.64.text:
- Did you already know you would be staying in a garage?
- No.

83.64.text:
- No. We thought it looked nice in the brochure.
- Who did?

86.60.text:
- Me and my partner. 
- Partner?
- Girlfriend.

91.28.text: Blimey, that was a quick ten seconds, wasn't it?

95.32.text: OK, so you were going to Vannes.

98.92.text:
- Went to a tourist information place. 
- Because you hadn't booked anywhere.

102.08.text:
- We hadn't booked.
- I'm with you.

103.52.text: What happened at the tourist information?

105.36.text: They said, "What about this place?" And we said, "That looks nice."

108.32.text: A house with a nice pool, looked nice in the picture, so we went there.

116.60.text: The house was nice but we were in the garage.

119.48.text: Was the garage decked out to look like a room

121.60.text: or was it just spanners and...?

123.16.text: It looked like a room with a canoe on the side and a fuse box.

127.52.text:
- Am I old before my time but...
- Yes. 
- ..at 38, you don't go on a crazy...

131.32.text: "Not going to book where we're going." At 38 you want to know where you're going.

134.80.text:
- I'm with you, Hal. 
- Get a nice comfy room.

136.52.text: You know, if this is true,

137.76.text: you totally deserve what happened to you.

140.76.text: I didn't say I didn't enjoy it.

142.84.text: So it was a deliberate rough and tumble.

145.88.text:
- How long did you stay for in the garage?
- Two weeks.

149.20.text: You stayed for two weeks?! How much did you pay?

153.76.text: I'm not surprised. Did it have any windows in the garage?

157.56.text:
- No.
- And you said there was a swimming pool?

159.84.text: Yeah, they had a swimming pool.

161.20.text:
- You were allowed to use it?
- No.

164.64.text: I can't help thinking that what you're describing

167.16.text: is more of a hostage scenario.

170.56.text: And what about Mrs Gilbert, she wasn't Mrs Gilbert then,

173.36.text: but how did she react? Because she's looking at you, Rhod,

183.08.text: Was there not a little part of her that died that day

186.28.text: when she saw what you expected her to put up with?

189.88.text: She wasn't very well, if I remember rightly.

192.24.text: Was it carbon monoxide or exhaust fumes?

197.08.text: All right, Lee. It's a complex tale. What do your team think?

211.72.text: Like what? All right, it did have windows.

217.12.text: It's like he's throwing in things that seem so ridiculous.

219.80.text: No, but nobody would go and stay in a garage without windows.

230.16.text: OK, what's it going to be, Lee? Truth or lie?

235.44.text: I think it's true but I'll go with my team and say it's a lie.

238.28.text: You're going to say lie. OK, Rhod, garage holiday in France.

241.80.text:
- Truth or lie?
- Holiday in the Frenchman's garage in Vannes,

254.36.text: Rhod did once have a holiday in a Frenchman's garage.
